I love the concept of the build. Unfortunately SC V isn't possible in a level 30 environment, so I cut Elf from the original build for Human.
This lets you get Weapon Finesse at level 1 rather than level 9, resulting in a more versatile early life.

Let me know what you think, criticism appreciated. Thanks!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hello wildleaf!
I have an elven F8/ WM16/ SD16 with ED and SCV buried in a special folder on my hard drive. It is a build that I only play on special occasions. It is great in a high magic environment for dueling against other meleers.
The levelling order is only slightly different from the Ghost elf build you link to.
As for your dex build:
It is a strong defensive build with a high AB. The damage it makes is not very good, but that is a common problem with dexers, and you will depend on item properties on your weapon for better damage.
I think it is reasonable to pick human, since you don't have to build for SCV. It seems to me that you end up with one pre epic feat too much and pick a skill focus. I would have picked Improved critical, or perhaps power attack for added damage.
It makes sense to take epic skill focus discipline if you want to rely on discipline rolls with your dexer. But many dexer builds drop discipline altogether, and do rather rely on a high AC, ED and SCV to avoid being knocked over or disarmed. With the high AC you can get in a high magic environment, that makes sense. You end up with a battle of 20s where the dexers outlast the strength builds, even dev crit builds.
You take a high heal skill. That is great in team multiplayer to save dying comrades, but elsewhere you can rely on potions. I do miss a scouting skill, such as listen.
You take WM11 and SD 11. Why not take 2 fighter levels and get another epic combat feat? I don't see epic prowess or armor skin in your build.
If you swap EWF and G-dex1, you get better AB in early epic levels, and still get high enough dex for ED at lvl 27.

Mick

Edit: Most WM builds have the following total number of WM Levels in the build: 5, 7, 13, 16, 19 ( and 22, 25, 28 in lvl 40 builds). That is because you get something extra at these levels. When you take 10 WM levels pre epic, it is usually because you intend to take more levels in epic for the superior weapon focus and the bonus feats. In this build you don't have to take more than 7 WM Levels to get what you aim for. WM8/ F9 pre epic will grant you one more bonus combat feat.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I will comment on your strength build in a separate post.
The dex build takes 10 levels of SD to qualify for ED. Frankly you don't need that here. You only take just enough stealth skills to qualify for SD. That makes HIPS worthless and only leaves the tumble dumps for SD. Rogue does it MUCH BETTER! More skillpoints, SA damage, UMD, no cross classed skills etc.
You feel feat starved. Replace most of the 10 SD levels with more WM for better AB and bonus feats, Fighter to top up with feats, and a couple of rogue levels for skill dumps. Often it just doesn't make sense to make a strength and a dexterity version of the same build.

Mick

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I concur Wildleaf do something about your eleven weapon-master levels, they feel awkward.

Perhaps, Fighter 10/ SD 13/ Weapon-Master 7 or similar.
And absolutely take improved critical with your rapier, weapon-masters are all about the crits.

Otherwise, a good build overall.
